Author: jl777c#5810
Content: whoever said it costs $10K per year for BTC txfees is off by a factor of 10 or more

Content: for a 13 signature notarization, we are paying about $10 each

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: about 50 BTC per year

Author: Alright#0419

Author: Biz#0842
Content: Ah, well whatâ€™s the point of a notarization every 10 minutes?

Author: Biz#0842
Content: When a single block can take longer than that to confirm once?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: limiting the time to conduct a 51% attack

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on the non-notarized blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you notarized once per day, the cost would be a lot lower, but you would go an entire day between notarizations

Author: Biz#0842
Content: I donâ€™t see how a non-confirmed BTC tx should be used to prevent that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the non-notarized blocks are at risk

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: BTC blocks arrive on average once per 10 minutes

Author: Biz#0842
Content: Okay. So just design choices we arenâ€™t seeing eye to eye on really

Author: Biz#0842
Content: I would think once per hour would be sufficient to prevent large rollbacks.

Author: Biz#0842

I was thinking about an idea of an oracle that tracks BTC fees.
